intro: Barkeria melanocaulon, commonly known as the black-stemmed barkeria, is a small shrub native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Fabaceae, which includes legumes, and is characterized by its compound leaves and flowering stems. The plant produces small, pea-like flowers that range in color from white to pale yellow. Its bark is dark and fissured, giving it its common name. Barkeria melanocaulon is often found in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to dry, Mediterranean climates.
